item.title: Colorado Northern Front Range Mountain Backdrop Protection Study Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

summary.text: Colorado Northern Front Range Mountain Backdrop Protection Study Act - Requires the Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Chief of the Forest Service, to conduct a study of the lands within the study area (certain lands in or adjacent to the Arapaho and Roosevelt National Forests in southern Boulder, northern Jefferson, and northern Gilpin Counties, Colorado) and report to Congress on: (1) the ownership of such lands; (2) any undeveloped land that may be at risk of development; and (3) actions that could be taken by the United States, Colorado, or any other parties to preserve the open and undeveloped character of such lands.

bill.title: Colorado Northern Front Range Mountain Backdrop Protection Study Act

item.title: Colorado Northern Front Range Mountain Backdrop Protection Study Act

A bill to provide for a study of options for protecting the open space characteristics of certain land in and adjacent to the Arapaho and Roosevelt National Forests in the State of Colorado, and for other purposes.
Colorado Northern Front Range Mountain Backdrop Protection Study Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
